text: I'm reading about the yield keyword in python, and trying to understand running this sample:

code:
def countfrom(n):
    while True:
        print "before yield"
        yield n
        n += 1
        print "after yield"

for i in countfrom(10):
    print "enter for loop"
    if i <= 20:
        print i
    else:
        break

text: It looks like the yield will return the specified value, and will continue runnning the function till the end (in a parallel thread, maybe).
If you could answer this without mentioning "generators", I would be thankful, because I'm trying to understand one at a time.
